1.title: Economy
1.plot: Prime Votes National Forum Part One delved into concerns centering on the economy, illegal immigration, and unemployment. The expert panel included Fred Grandy, former congressman from Iowa, former Senate Minority Leader Trent Lott from Mississippi, Clarence Page from the Chicago Tribune, and Elliot Spitzer, former Governor of New York.

2.title: Social Security
2.plot: Prime Votes National Forum Part Two explored the highly contentious issues of the future of health care and Social Security and enlisted such eminent lawmakers as Senator Tom Daschle of South Dakota, Representative Mike Burgess of Texas, Representative Jan Schakowsky of Illinois, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, and Representative Dan Lungren of California.

imdb.plot outline: As the cornerstone of RLTV's Prime Votes initiative-a gamut of urgent and unprecedented programming aimed at informing and mobilizing voters 55+ in the recent mid-term election-National Forum was presented in two 60-minute specials and hosted by Cokie Roberts, the senior news analyst for NPR and chief congressional analyst for ABC News. The programs provided an arena for voters 55+ to directly air their concerns as pollsters Frank Luntz and Mark Mellman led "Man on the Street" packages giving seniors a chance to have their voices heard. Ms. Roberts moderated discussions in the studio which centered on roundtable conversation and debate and featured an impressive panel of leading opinion-makers and political insiders from both parties who sat down with senior voters in order to delve deeply and candidly into the troubling issues imperative to seniors in the upcoming election.
imdb.title: Prime Votes
plot: As the cornerstone of RLTV's _Prime Votes_ (qv) initiative-a gamut of urgent and unprecedented programming aimed at informing and mobilizing voters 55+ in the recent mid-term election-National Forum was presented in two 60-minute specials and hosted by Cokie Roberts, the senior news analyst for NPR and chief congressional analyst for ABC _News_ (qv). The programs provided an arena for voters 55+ to directly air their concerns as pollsters Frank Luntz and Mark Mellman led "Man on the Street" packages giving seniors a chance to have their voices heard. Ms. Roberts moderated discussions in the studio which centered on roundtable conversation and debate and featured an impressive panel of leading opinion-makers and political insiders from both parties who sat down with senior voters in order to delve deeply and candidly into the troubling issues imperative to seniors in the upcoming election.::RLTV [us]
